sen.j: 本三尊像の堂々とした量感や写実的な表現は、この当時流行した定朝様（じょうちょうよう）の繊細優美な仏像とは異なった作風を示し、次の鎌倉時代の作風のさきがけをなすといわれる。
sen.e: The expression of the three statues shows a different style from the one prevailed by the time of the production, the Jocho style, by which statues of Buddha are often described as delicate and elegant, rather than imposing and realistic, and thus is said to be indicative of an incoming mode that would be dominant during the Kamakura period.

At the time, the style called Jocho, in which mainly delicacy and elegance were expressed in Buddhist images, prevailed, yet these statues rather express massiveness and realism and do not seem to follow the Jocho style; therefore, it is said that they were indicative of an incoming mode that was becoming dominant during the Kamakura period.

sen.e: The design of the three statues, particularly on the both-sides attendants that are half lotus positioned, hanging one leg down of each statue, is reminiscent of statues of the Nara period, and thus can be an indication for re-establishing the ancient style.
